availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Clay Kerr (Henderson County, Kentucky, plasterer and deputy sheriff)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, plasterer and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of John H. Kerr and Nancy Coons Kerr. Married to Isabella Rouse Kerr in Henderson County on December 30, 1852. Father Edwin Kerr, James Henry Kerr, Walter D. Kerr, Mattie Kerr, and Malcolm Kerr. Plasterer in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Plasterer in Henderson County in 1860. Deputy Sheriff in Henderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 187A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p.14.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson Ward 4, p. 147A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 22466.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 000576460.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Henderson County, KY, July 1863, p. 13.
"Henry Clay Kerr (1829-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 85708807, accessed December 9, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85708807.
